comment.author: 34404855@N07
comment._content:
Emigrated, not 'immigrated'.  You leave a country; you emigrate.  If you are to be described as a person who has settled from afar, you are an immigrant.  Peculiar English spelling - shared with US English - is that 'immigrant' has 2 'mm's'; 'emigrant' has only one.

Too many youngsters on your staff?

comment.author: 25053835@N03
comment._content: Thanks for finding that and see the update above. With as many collections as we have under our care, grammar mistakes can happen!

comment._content: Hi, I'm an admin for a group called Fabulous Fungi Fotographers, and we'd love to have this added to the group!
